Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2006 12:28PM boobbuster wrote: Hey gang I feel poopy to today. My body aches and my kids are so dis-respectful! I think I want to lock them in a cave until they come back to human form. I don't think my kids care about what I'm going through. They're 13 years old and I know that puberty is a wierd time for a kid but they've got to cut me some slack. There's nobody to take care of me, only me taking care of everybody else. Seems unfair given my state of health. But my family doesn't think twice about it. I've always been and will alway be SUPERWOMAN! Sorry to change the subject of this thread in mid stream but life is so complicated right now. My kids talk back, slam doors, stomp their feet and act like little three year olds. I took them to chemo treatment yesterday thinking that if they visually saw what I went through they would be compassionate, but NO... they fought in the the infusion room over the FREAKIN TV! I'm so pissed right now. I think they're ungrateful brats and It's all my fault. I've always but them first and they know it and now they expect it no matter what. I don't want the rest of my life to be all about giving them what they want and no one considering my feels, fears and needs. I had to ask my son to hug me yesterday after chemo and he said, "Mom I'm so sorry, I didn't know you went through this every week". That compassion lasted until we got to the car and voted on where to have dinner. A fight lasted for 2 hours dinner was awful and play refree the whole time. I barely made it through dinner and got just enough energy to climb in bed. Well so much for "As the World Turns" but this is a day in the life of single mama with drama! Emmy award winner drama. I think I'm about to lose it.... Do they make pink straight jackets? God is able, Boobbuster
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2007 10:18PM boobbuster wrote: Bonnie- Glad to here you've started your Herceptin and Carol, hip-hip-huray for the chemo break. Isn't life sweeter with no side-effects? Sherry- Hope your scans go well today; I'll be thinking/praying for good results! Yes my lunch date was nice; it's always nice to see old friends. I start my taxotere treatments back tuesday. Take care homegirls!

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2006 07:59AM boobbuster wrote: I just found this tennessee tread and and christmas miracles and wanted to introduce myself. I've been posting here for quite some time. I mainly post in the recurrance and triple negative tread. My son's school blessed our family with a $2500 gift on thursday. I'm still amazed that people are still so giving, given the state of the world. Thank God there are still Christians. I feel fortunate to have received the money that I don't know what to do with it. I will bless a child next week with a Angel Tree or something. Anyway, look forward to hearing from you all. Boobbuster

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2007 11:53AM boobbuster wrote: Thanks Carol ! First things first... I had to change my username because it was attracting weird people to the site. Secondly, I had my scans today and it showed "partial response". The lung mets are shrinking and I have 4 more treatments to go. I'm praying that we get stable or NED in the next month. My new username is TripleNeg. Please keep me in your prayers. Stephanie
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2006 10:43AM boobbuster wrote: All is well ladies, I'm actually glad I got it all out. I'm trying to get all this Christmas stuff packed away and make final returns and exchanges. I have one final treatment next week before I have a two week break and then scans. I'm so looking forward to not having chemo for a while and... I'm enjoying my time with the boys. Bonny- I think you'll like the taxotere, it doesn't have half the side effects. You're such a trooper. I wish I had found this site before I was stage 4.
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2006 10:19AM boobbuster wrote: I was dx after a breast reduction and told that I didn't need chemo just a mastectomy. 9 months later it was in my lungs. I had the spot on my lung removed and did Carboplatin and Taxol (4 treatments) and went to NED until November when it showing up in both lungs now. I'm on weekly Taxotere for 3 months.I live in middle tennessee and have all my life. I've found that this site is the only place where I can meet women who know what I'm going through. I have a small family and we rarely talk about breast cancer. Talk to you soon. God is able, Boobbuster
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2006 02:53PM boobbuster wrote: Hi Tennessee Girls! I had a great day. Wasn't sick today and actually got some cleaning done. Taking chemo weekly is a job in and of it self. I had another family friend bring by a love offering from her church sunday school. God is good! He has watched over me through all of this and I'm very grateful. Did my thank you cards and christmas cards today. The post office was packed! I opted to go to UPS instead. Anyway, I haven't lost my hair yet with taxotere. Will I lose it? It's day 12 and only a sore scalp. I'm taking small doses so maybe it won't fall out. Have great evening ladies, I've got my son's studying for finals as tomorrow is the last date of school before Christmas break. It's nice not having to compete for the internet! Boobbuster
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2007 03:59PM boobbuster wrote: Hi every one. Just wanted to do my weekly check in and roll call. Hope everyone is doing great! Bonny, Carol and Nellie, I'ved decided to limit my internet posting to once a week now since I'm not working. I've found that I spend way too much time surfing the net and fousing on bc. I've decided to do some advocacy work for bc research and try to redirect my enegery. Plus I've gained ten pounds cooking recipes and stuff! Carol, I'm so gray right now it's not funny. I lost all my hair over night. It's super thin now. Oh well. It'll grow back. Carol also, I stoped taking the decadron and only take what they give me before chemo infusions. I've got the round face too. I feel like a BLOWFISH. I had to go to the hospital last week for mouth sores. They gave me miracle mouthwash that really helped. Any ways, just wanted to say hello and check in on my homegirls. Stay sweet and talk to you soon! Stephanie

Posts.Content: boobbuster wrote: I just happened to have looked at my radiology transcription online today and found that I have and have had for at least 6 months a anterior mediastinal mass. It's approximately 3.1 x 1.3cm. Why didn't my OC mention this to me? I know that the bone on my chest is putruding but I thought it was the port. Even though it's stable I know this can't be good. I thought I was just dealing with lung mets; but this is a totally new deck of cards. Is any one else dealing with anything like this? God is able, Stephanie Log in to post a reply
